017package ninja.leaping.configurate;
018
019import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList;
020import com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken;
021import ninja.leaping.configurate.loader.ConfigurationLoader;
022import ninja.leaping.configurate.objectmapping.ObjectMappingException;
023import ninja.leaping.configurate.objectmapping.serialize.TypeSerializer;
024import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.NonNull;
025import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.Nullable;
026
027import java.util.Collection;
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.function.Consumer;
031import java.util.function.Function;
032import java.util.function.Supplier;
033
034/**
035 * A node in the configuration tree.
036 *
037 * <p>All aspects of a configurations structure are represented using instances of
038 * {@link ConfigurationNode}, and the links between them.</p>
039 *
040 * <p>{@link ConfigurationNode}s can hold different types of {@link ValueType values}. They can:</p>
041 *
042 * <ul>
043 *     <li>Hold a single "scalar" value ({@link ValueType#SCALAR})</li>
044 *     <li>Represent a "list" of child {@link ConfigurationNode}s ({@link ValueType#LIST})</li>
045 *     <li>Represent a "map" of child {@link ConfigurationNode}s ({@link ValueType#MAP})</li>
046 *     <li>Hold no value at all ({@link ValueType#NULL})</li>
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <p>The overall configuration stems from a single "root" node, which is provided by the
050 * {@link ConfigurationLoader}, or by other means programmatically.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>This is effectively the main class of configurate.</p>
053 */
054public interface ConfigurationNode {
055    int NUMBER_DEF = 0;
056
057    @NonNull
058    static ConfigurationNode root() {
059        return root(ConfigurationOptions.defaults());
060    }
061
062    @NonNull
063    static ConfigurationNode root(Consumer<ConfigurationNode> action) {
064        return root(ConfigurationOptions.defaults(), action);
065    }
066
067    @NonNull
068    static ConfigurationNode root(@NonNull ConfigurationOptions options) {
069        return new SimpleConfigurationNode(null, null, options);
070    }
071
072    @NonNull
073    static ConfigurationNode root(@NonNull ConfigurationOptions options, Consumer<ConfigurationNode> action) {
074        return new SimpleConfigurationNode(null, null, options).act(action);
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Gets the "key" of this node.
079     *
080     * <p>The key determines this {@link ConfigurationNode}s position within the overall
081     * configuration structure.</p>
082     *
083     * <p>If this node is currently {@link #isVirtual() virtual}, this method's result may be
084     * inaccurate.</p>
085     *
086     * <p>Note that this method only returns the nearest "link" in the hierarchy, and does not
087     * return a representation of the full path. See {@link #getPath()} for that.</p>
088     *
089     * <p>The {@link ConfigurationNode}s returned as values from {@link #getChildrenMap()} will
090     * have keys derived from their pairing in the map node.</p>
091     *
092     * <p>The {@link ConfigurationNode}s returned from {@link #getChildrenList()} will have keys
093     * derived from their position (index) in the list node.</p>
094     *
095     * @return The key of this node
096     */
097    @Nullable
098    Object getKey();
099
100    /**
101     * Gets the full path of {@link #getKey() keys} from the root node to this node.
102     *
103     * <p>Node implementations may not keep a full path for each node, so this method may be
104     * somewhat complex to calculate.</p>
105     *
106     * @return An array compiled from the keys for each node up the hierarchy
107     */
108    @NonNull
109    Object[] getPath();
110
111    /**
112     * Gets the parent of this node.
113     *
114     * <p>If this node is currently {@link #isVirtual() virtual}, this method's result may be
115     * inaccurate.</p>
116     *
117     * @return The nodes parent
118     */
119    @Nullable
120    ConfigurationNode getParent();
121
122    /**
123     * Gets the node at the given (relative) path, possibly traversing multiple levels of nodes.
124     *
125     * <p>This is the main method used to navigate through the configuration.</p>
126     *
127     * <p>The path parameter effectively consumes an array of keys, which locate the unique position
128     * of a given node within the structure.</p>
129     *
130     * <p>A node is <b>always</b> returned by this method. If the given node does not exist in the
131     * structure, a {@link #isVirtual() virtual} node will be returned which represents the
132     * position.</p>
133     *
134     * @param path The path to fetch the node at
135     * @return The node at the given path, possibly virtual
136     */
137    @NonNull
138    ConfigurationNode getNode(@NonNull Object... path);
139
140    /**
141     * Gets if this node is virtual.
142     *
143     * <p>Virtual nodes are nodes which are not attached to a wider configuration structure.</p>
144     *
145     * <p>A node is primarily "virtual" when it has no set value.</p>
146     *
147     * @return true if this node is virtual
148     */
149    boolean isVirtual();
150
151    /**
152     * Gets the options that currently apply to this node
153     *
154     * @return The ConfigurationOptions instance that governs the functionality of this node
155     */
156    @NonNull
157    ConfigurationOptions getOptions();
158
159    /**
160     * Gets the value type of this node.
161     *
162     * @return The value type
163     */
164    @NonNull
165    ValueType getValueType();
166
167    /**
168     * Gets if this node has "list children".
169     *
170     * @return if this node has children in the form of a list
171     */
172    default boolean isList() {
173        return getValueType() == ValueType.LIST;
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Gets if this node has "map children".
178     *
179     * @return if this node has children in the form of a map
180     */
181    default boolean isMap() {
182        return getValueType() == ValueType.MAP;
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Gets if this node has "list children".
187     *
188     * @return if this node has children in the form of a list
189     * @deprecated Use {@link #isList()} instead
190     */
191    @Deprecated
192    default boolean hasListChildren() {
193        return isList();
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Gets if this node has "map children"
198     *
199     * @return if this node has children in the form of a map
200     * @deprecated Use {@link #isMap()} instead
201     */
202    @Deprecated
203    default boolean hasMapChildren() {
204        return isMap();
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Return true when this node has a null or empty value. Values that may result in this method returning true include:
209     *
210     * <ul>
211     *     <li><code>null</code></li>
212     *     <li>the empty string</li>
213     *     <li>an empty map</li>
214     *     <li>an empty list</li>
215     *     <li>Any other type of empty collection</li>
216     * </ul>
217     *
218     * This is a distinct value from {@link #isVirtual()}. Emptiness refers to the value of this node itself,
219     * while virtuality refers to whether or not this node
220     *
221     * @return Whether this node is empty
222     */
223    boolean isEmpty();
224
225    /**
226     * Gets the "list children" attached to this node, if it has any.
227     *
228     * <p>If this node does not {@link #isList() have list children}, an empty list is
229     * returned.</p>
230     *
231     * @return The list children currently attached to this node
232     */
233    @NonNull
234    List<? extends ConfigurationNode> getChildrenList();
235
236    /**
237     * Gets the "map children" attached to this node, if it has any.
238     *
239     * <p>If this node does not {@link #isMap() have map children}, an empty map
240     * returned.</p>
241     *
242     * @return The map children currently attached to this node
243     */
244    @NonNull
245    Map<Object, ? extends ConfigurationNode> getChildrenMap();
246
247    /**
248     * Get the current value associated with this node.
249     *
250     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
251     * or a Map.</p>
252     *
253     * @see #getValue(Object)
254     * @return This configuration's current value, or null if there is none
255     */
256    @Nullable
257    default Object getValue() {
258        return getValue((Object) null);
259    }
260
261    /**
262     * Get the current value associated with this node.
263     *
264     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
265     * or a Map.</p>
266     *
267     * @param def The default value to return if this node has no set value
268     * @return This configuration's current value, or {@code def} if there is none
269     */
270    Object getValue(@Nullable Object def);
271
272    /**
273     * Get the current value associated with this node.
274     *
275     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
276     * or a Map.</p>
277     *
278     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if
279     *                    there is no existing value
280     * @return This configuration's current value, or {@code def} if there is none
281     */
282    Object getValue(@NonNull Supplier<Object> defSupplier);
283
284    /**
285     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
286     * transformation function.
287     *
288     * @param transformer The transformation function
289     * @param <T> The expected type
290     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or null either if no value is present or the
291     * value could not be converted
292     */
293    @Nullable
294    default <T> T getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer) {
295        return getValue(transformer, (T) null);
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
300     * transformation function.
301     *
302     * @param transformer The transformation function
303     * @param def The default value to return if this node has no set value or is not of a
304     *            convertible type
305     * @param <T> The expected type
306     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or {@code def} either if no value is present
307     * or the value could not be converted
308     */
309    <T> T getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer, @Nullable T def);
310
311    /**
312     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
313     * transformation function.
314     *
315     * @param transformer The transformation function
316     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if
317     *                    there is no existing value of the correct type
318     * @param <T> The expected type
319     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or {@code def} either if no value is present
320     * or the value could not be converted
321     */
322    <T> T getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer, @NonNull Supplier<T> defSupplier);
323
324    /**
325     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
326     * type based on the provided function.
327     *
328     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value</p>
329     *
330     * @param transformer The transformation function
331     * @param <T> The expected type
332     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained
333     */
334    @NonNull
335    <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer);
336
337    /**
338     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
339     * type based on the provided function.
340     *
341     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
342     *
343     * @param transformer The transformation function
344     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
345     * @param <T> The expected type
346     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
347     * values could be converted
348     */
349    <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer, @Nullable List<T> def);
350
351    /**
352     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
353     * type based on the provided function.
354     *
355     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
356     *
357     * @param transformer The transformation function
358     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
359     *                    value of the correct type
360     * @param <T> The expected type
361     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
362     * values could be converted
363     */
364    <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, T> transformer, @NonNull Supplier<List<T>> defSupplier);
365
366    /**
367     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
368     * type based on the provided function.
369     *
370     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
371     *
372     * @param type The expected type
373     * @param <T> The expected type
374     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained
375     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
376     */
377    @NonNull
378    default <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type) throws ObjectMappingException {
379        return getList(type, ImmutableList.of());
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
384     * type based on the provided function.
385     *
386     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
387     *
388     * @param type The expected type
389     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
390     * @param <T> The expected type
391     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
392     * values could be converted
393     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
394     */
395    <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type, @Nullable List<T> def) throws ObjectMappingException;
396
397    /**
398     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
399     * type based on the provided function.
400     *
401     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
402     *
403     * @param type The expected type
404     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
405     *                    value of the correct type
406     * @param <T> The expected type
407     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
408     * values could be converted
409     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
410     */
411    <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type, @NonNull Supplier<List<T>> defSupplier) throws ObjectMappingException;
412
413    /**
414     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
415     *
416     * @see #getValue()
417     * @return The appropriate type conversion, null if no appropriate value is available
418     */
419    @Nullable
420    default String getString() {
421        return getString(null);
422    }
423
424    /**
425     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
426     *
427     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
428     * @see #getValue()
429     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
430     */
431    default String getString(@Nullable String def) {
432        return getValue(Types::asString, def);
433    }
434
435    /**
436     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
437     *
438     * @see #getValue()
439     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
440     */
441    default float getFloat() {
442        return getFloat(NUMBER_DEF);
443    }
444
445    /**
446     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
447     *
448     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
449     * @see #getValue()
450     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
451     */
452    default float getFloat(float def) {
453        return getValue(Types::asFloat, def);
454    }
455
456    /**
457     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
458     *
459     * @see #getValue()
460     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
461     */
462    default double getDouble() {
463        return getDouble(NUMBER_DEF);
464    }
465
466    /**
467     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
468     *
469     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
470     * @see #getValue()
471     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
472     */
473    default double getDouble(double def) {
474        return getValue(Types::asDouble, def);
475    }
476
477    /**
478     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
479     *
480     * @see #getValue()
481     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
482     */
483    default int getInt() {
484        return getInt(NUMBER_DEF);
485    }
486
487    /**
488     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
489     *
490     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
491     * @see #getValue()
492     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
493     */
494    default int getInt(int def) {
495        return getValue(Types::asInt, def);
496    }
497
498    /**
499     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
500     *
501     * @see #getValue()
502     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
503     */
504    default long getLong() {
505        return getLong(NUMBER_DEF);
506    }
507
508    /**
509     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
510     *
511     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
512     * @see #getValue()
513     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
514     */
515    default long getLong(long def) {
516        return getValue(Types::asLong, def);
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
521     *
522     * @see #getValue()
523     * @return The appropriate type conversion, false if no appropriate value is available
524     */
525    default boolean getBoolean() {
526        return getBoolean(false);
527    }
528
529    /**
530     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Types}
531     *
532     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
533     * @see #getValue()
534     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
535     */
536    default boolean getBoolean(boolean def) {
537        return getValue(Types::asBoolean, def);
538    }
539
540    /**
541     * Get the current value associated with this node.
542     *
543     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
544     * List or a Map.</p>
545     *
546     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
547     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
548     *
549     * @param type The type to deserialize to
550     * @param <T> the type to get
551     * @return the value if present and of the proper type, else null
552     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
553     */
554    @Nullable
555    default <T> T getValue(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type) throws ObjectMappingException {
556        return getValue(type, (T) null);
557    }
558
559    /**
560     * Get the current value associated with this node.
561     *
562     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
563     * List or a Map.</p>
564     *
565     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
566     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
567     *
568     * @param type The type to deserialize to
569     * @param def The value to return if no value or value is not of appropriate type
570     * @param <T> the type to get
571     * @return the value if of the proper type, else {@code def}
572     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
573     */
574    <T> T getValue(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type, T def) throws ObjectMappingException;
575
576    /**
577     * Get the current value associated with this node.
578     *
579     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
580     * List or a Map.</p>
581     *
582     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
583     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
584     *
585     * @param type The type to deserialize to
586     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
587     *                    value of the correct type
588     * @param <T> the type to get
589     * @return the value if of the proper type, else {@code def}
590     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
591     */
592    <T> T getValue(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type, @NonNull Supplier<T> defSupplier) throws ObjectMappingException;
593
594    /**
595     * Set this node's value to the given value.
596     *
597     * <p>If the provided value is a {@link Collection} or a {@link Map}, it will be unwrapped into
598     * the appropriate configuration node structure.</p>
599     *
600     * @param value The value to set
601     * @return this
602     */
603    @NonNull
604    ConfigurationNode setValue(@Nullable Object value);
605
606    /**
607     * Set this node's value to the given value.
608     *
609     * <p>If the provided value is a {@link Collection} or a {@link Map}, it will be unwrapped into
610     * the appropriate configuration node structure.</p>
611     *
612     * <p>This method will also perform serialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for the
613     * given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
614     *
615     * @param type The type to use for serialization type information
616     * @param value The value to set
617     * @param <T> The type to serialize to
618     * @return this
619     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type. No change will be made to the node.
620     */
621    @NonNull
622    default <T> ConfigurationNode setValue(@NonNull TypeToken<T> type, @Nullable T value) throws ObjectMappingException {
623        if (value == null) {
624            setValue(null);
625            return this;
626        }
627
628        TypeSerializer<T> serial = getOptions().getSerializers().get(type);
629        if (serial != null) {
630            serial.serialize(type, value, this);
631        } else if (getOptions().acceptsType(value.getClass())) {
632            setValue(value); // Just write if no applicable serializer exists?
633        } else {
634            throw new ObjectMappingException("No serializer available for type " + type);
635        }
636        return this;
637    }
638
639    /**
640     * Set all the values from the given node that are not present in this node
641     * to their values in the provided node.
642     *
643     * <p>Map keys will be merged. Lists and scalar values will be replaced.</p>
644     *
645     * @param other The node to merge values from
646     * @return this
647     */
648    @NonNull
649    ConfigurationNode mergeValuesFrom(@NonNull ConfigurationNode other);
650
651    /**
652     * Removes a direct child of this node
653     *
654     * @param key The key of the node to remove
655     * @return If a node was removed
656     */
657    boolean removeChild(@NonNull Object key);
658
659    /**
660     * Gets a new child node created as the next entry in the list.
661     *
662     * @return A new child created as the next entry in the list when it is attached
663     * @deprecated Use {@link #appendListNode()} instead
664     */
665    @Deprecated
666    @NonNull
667    ConfigurationNode getAppendedNode();
668
669    /**
670     * Gets a new child node created as the next entry in the list.
671     *
672     * @return A new child created as the next entry in the list when it is attached
673     */
674    @NonNull
675    default ConfigurationNode appendListNode() {
676        return getAppendedNode();
677    }
678
679    /**
680     * Creates a deep copy of this node.
681     *
682     * <p>If this node has child nodes (is a list or map), the child nodes will
683     * also be copied. This action is performed recursively.</p>
684     *
685     * <p>The resultant node will (initially) contain the same value(s) as this node,
686     * and will therefore be {@link Object#equals(Object) equal}, however, changes made to
687     * the original will not be reflected in the copy, and vice versa.</p>
688     *
689     * <p>The actual scalar values that back the configuration will
690     * <strong>not</strong> be copied - only the node structure that forms the
691     * configuration. This is not a problem in most cases, as the scalar values
692     * stored in configurations are usually immutable. (e.g. strings, numbers, booleans).</p>
693     *
694     * @return A copy of this node
695     */
696    @NonNull
697    ConfigurationNode copy();
698
699    /**
700     * Execute an action on this node. This allows performing multiple operations
701     * on a single node without having to clutter up the surrounding scope.
702     *
703     * @param action The action to perform on this node
704     * @return this
705     */
706    default ConfigurationNode act(Consumer<? super ConfigurationNode> action) {
707        action.accept(this);
708        return this;
709    }
710
711    /**
712     * Visit this node hierarchy as described in {@link ConfigurationVisitor}
713     *
714     * @param visitor The visitor
715     * @param <S> The state type
716     * @param <T> The terminal type
717     * @param <E> exception type that may be thrown
718     * @throws E when throw by visitor implementation
719     * @return The returned terminal from the visitor
720     */
721    default <S, T, E extends Exception> T visit(ConfigurationVisitor<S, T, E> visitor) throws E {
722        return visit(visitor, visitor.newState());
723    }
724
725    /**
726     * Visit this node hierarchy as described in {@link ConfigurationVisitor}
727     *
728     * @param visitor The visitor
729     * @param state The state to start with
730     * @param <T> The terminal type
731     * @param <S> The state type
732     * @param <E> exception type that may be thrown
733     * @throws E when throw by visitor implementation
734     * @return The returned terminal from the visitor
735     */
736    <S, T, E extends Exception> T visit(ConfigurationVisitor<S, T, E> visitor, S state) throws E;
737
738    /**
739     * Visit this node hierarchy as described in {@link ConfigurationVisitor}
740     * This overload will remove the need for exception handling for visitors that do not have any checked exceptions.
741     *
742     * @param visitor The visitor
743     * @param <S> The state type
744     * @param <T> The terminal type
745     * @return The returned terminal from the visitor
746     */
747    default <S, T> T visit(ConfigurationVisitor.Safe<S, T> visitor) {
748        return visit(visitor, visitor.newState());
749    }
750
751    /**
752     * Visit this node hierarchy as described in {@link ConfigurationVisitor}
753     * This overload will remove the need for exception handling for visitors that do not have any checked exceptions.
754     *
755     * @param visitor The visitor
756     * @param state The state to start with
757     * @param <T> The terminal type
758     * @param <S> The state type
759     * @return The returned terminal from the visitor
760     */
761    <S, T> T visit(ConfigurationVisitor.Safe<S, T> visitor, S state);
762
763}
